body: There is currently no way to set defaults application-wide. Instantiation could go through dependency container. Then it would be possible.

issue.title: Session cookie should have secure flag if set over https

repository.name: humhub
repository.description: HumHub is an Open Source Enterprise Social Network. Easy to install, intuitive to use and extendable with countless freely available modules.

issue.body: This cookie, which has been sent over an encrypted channel, doesn't have the secure flag set. As a result, an active network attacker can easily recover it.

issue.title: Use DI container to instantiate cookies in order to be able to set defaults

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

| Is bugfix?    |no
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | 
| Fixed issues  | #13486

issue.title: Session secure flag

repository.name: luya
repository.description: LUYA is a scalable web framework and content management system with the goal to please developers, clients and users alike.

issue.body:
If ensureSecureConnection is enabled the following things should be done:

+ Set secure flag for user cookies when secure connection is enabled. (https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/13486)
+ Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS) header `Strict-Transport-Security: max-
age=2592000` => 
+ X-Headers:
  + X-Frame-Options Header: SAMEORIGIN
  + X-XSS-Protection Header: `X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block`
  + Content-Security-Policy Header
